result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derik Jay Walter

records.addlTxt: Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.

Case called @ 10:53 AM Defendant Derik Jay Walter not in court, Attorney Matthew R. Leusink for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. 22TR87 - Default Judgment entered. Court orders the bond amount noted on the citation w/ 60 DTP or PP.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department by March 1, 2022. Executed bond form to be returned to the Clerk of Courts Office by no later than March 1, 2022. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Cases called @ 4:03 p.m. Defendant Derik Jay Walter appeared by phone, Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE requests counsel. Based on the defendant's earnings the Court will expect the defendant to privately retain counsel. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond. 22TR87 - NG plea entered. AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
